artifacts.content:
{
  "market_analysis": {
    "tam": {
      "value": "$2.5 billion",
      "calculation": "Estimated global market for cloud-based developer tools and DevOps platforms based on industry reports and analyst projections",
      "source_type": "estimate"
    },
    "sam": {
      "value": "$750 million",
      "calculation": "Narrowed from TAM to focus on enterprise and power user segment for advanced developer tooling in North America and Europe",
      "geographic_scope": "North America and Europe"
    },
    "som": {
      "value": "$75 million",
      "calculation": "Estimated 10% market share achievable in 3 years with strong product-market fit and enterprise sales focus",
      "assumptions": [
        "Successful positioning as a premium, AI-powered developer platform",
        "Adoption by 1,000+ enterprise customers",
        "Average revenue per customer of $75k/year"
      ]
    },
    "growth_rate": "12% CAGR",
    "market_stage": "growing",
    "timing_assessment": "The market for advanced developer tooling is growing rapidly, driven by the increasing complexity of software development, the need for better visibility and control over the development lifecycle, and the rise of DevOps and cloud-native architectures. This is an opportune time to enter the market with a differentiated product that addresses the pain points of power users and enterprise developers."
  },
  "competitors": [
    {
      "name": "GitLab",
      "type": "direct",
      "description": "Integrated DevOps platform with built-in CI/CD, code review, and project management features",
      "strengths": [
        "Market leader in DevOps tooling",
        "Strong enterprise customer base",
        "Broad feature set"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Complex UI, steep learning curve",
        "Limited AI/ML capabilities",
        "Pricing can be high for SMBs"
      ],
      "pricing": "Free tier, $19/user/month for premium",
      "market_share_estimate": "30% of SAM",
      "key_differentiator": "End-to-end DevOps solution",
      "threat_level": "high"
    },
    {
      "name": "Atlassian Jira",
      "type": "indirect",
      "description": "Project management and issue tracking tool widely used by software teams",
      "strengths": [
        "Market leader in agile project management",
        "Broad ecosystem of integrations",
        "Strong brand recognition"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Limited DevOps and automation capabilities",
        "Can be complex for non-technical users",
        "Pricing model based on user seats"
      ],
      "pricing": "$7/user/month for Jira Core, $14.50/user/month for Jira Software",
      "market_share_estimate": "40% of project management tools market",
      "key_differentiator": "Agile project management focus",
      "threat_level": "medium"
    },
    {
      "name": "CircleCI",
      "type": "direct",
      "description": "Continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) platform",
      "strengths": [
        "Specialized in CI/CD workflows",
        "Strong integration with cloud platforms",
        "Scalable and reliable"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Limited project management and collaboration features",
        "Can be complex to configure for large enterprises",
        "Pricing based on compute resources"
      ],
      "pricing": "Free for open-source, $15/user/month for paid plans",
      "market_share_estimate": "20% of CI/CD tools market",
      "key_differentiator": "CI/CD specialization",
      "threat_level": "medium"
    }
  ],
  "trends": [
    {
      "trend": "Increasing complexity of software development",
      "type": "technology",
      "impact": "Driving demand for more sophisticated developer tools and platforms that provide better visibility, control, and automation across the development lifecycle",
      "timeline": "Current",
      "confidence": "high"
    },
    {
      "trend": "Rise of DevOps and cloud-native architectures",
      "type": "technology",
      "impact": "Fueling the need for integrated DevOps tooling that can manage the entire software development and deployment process",
      "timeline": "Current",
      "confidence": "high"
    },
    {
      "trend": "Adoption of AI and ML in developer tools",
      "type": "technology",
      "impact": "Enabling new capabilities like intelligent code analysis, automated testing, and personalized recommendations to improve developer productivity and efficiency",
      "timeline": "1-2 years",
      "confidence": "high"
    },
    {
      "trend": "Shift to remote and hybrid work",
      "type": "consumer",
      "impact": "Increasing the need for cloud-based, collaborative developer tools that support distributed teams",
      "timeline": "Current",
      "confidence": "high"
    }
  ],
  "swot": {
    "strengths": [
      "Focused on power users and enterprise developers, a underserved segment",
      "Ability to leverage AI and ML to provide intelligent insights and recommendations",
      "Integrated, end-to-end solution covering the entire software development lifecycle"
    ],
    "weaknesses": [
      "Competing against well-established players with large customer bases",
      "Need to build a robust ecosystem of integrations to match the breadth of competitors",
      "Potential challenges in enterprise sales and adoption due to the complexity of the product"
    ],
    "opportunities": [
      "Capitalize on the growing demand for advanced developer tools that can handle the increasing complexity of software development",
      "Differentiate by providing a superior user experience and AI-powered features that improve developer productivity and efficiency",
      "Expand into adjacent markets like project management and collaboration tools by offering a more integrated solution"
    ],
    "threats": [
      "Competitors may quickly match or surpass the AI and ML capabilities of the product",
      "Potential for consolidation in the market, leading to larger players acquiring or outcompeting smaller players",
      "Regulatory changes or security concerns that could impact the adoption of cloud-based developer tools"
    ]
  },
  "opportunities": [
    "Offer an AI-powered, end-to-end developer platform that provides a seamless and intelligent experience across the entire software development lifecycle",
    "Target the underserved enterprise and power user segment with a differentiated product that addresses their specific needs and pain points",
    "Leverage the growing demand for cloud-based, collaborative developer tools to drive adoption and growth"
  ],
  "risks": [
    {
      "risk": "Competitors quickly match or surpass the AI and ML capabilities of the product",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Continuously invest in R&D to stay ahead of the competition, build a strong patent portfolio, and form strategic partnerships with AI/ML leaders"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Challenges in enterprise sales and adoption due to the complexity of the product",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Invest in a robust onboarding and training program, provide extensive documentation and support resources, and build a strong network of enterprise sales and implementation partners"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Regulatory changes or security concerns impact the adoption of cloud-based developer tools",
      "probability": "low",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Ensure the product meets the highest security and compliance standards, obtain relevant certifications, and work closely with legal and regulatory experts to stay ahead of any changes"
    }
  ],
  "recommendation": {
    "market_attractiveness": "8/10 - The market for advanced developer tools is large, growing, and underserved, providing a significant opportunity for a differentiated product that leverages AI and ML capabilities",
    "entry_timing": "now",
    "key_success_factors": [
      "Deliver a seamless, end-to-end developer experience with intelligent features that improve productivity and efficiency",
      "Prioritize the enterprise and power user segment with a focus on user experience, security, and compliance",
      "Build a robust ecosystem of integrations and partnerships to expand the product's capabilities and reach"
    ]
  }
}

{
  "mvp_definition": {
    "core_value_proposition": "A centralized dashboard for developers to monitor and understand their builds in the OLYMPUS system",
    "target_user": "Power users and developers who want to gain visibility into their builds",
    "key_differentiator": "Provides a single pane of glass to track build progress, agent status, and constitutional compliance"
  },
  "mvp_features": [
    {
      "id": "build_list",
      "name": "Build List Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 90,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 9,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "Shows a list of active and completed builds with status indicators",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to see the status of my current and past builds so I can track progress and troubleshoot issues"
    },
    {
      "id": "phase_progression",
      "name": "Phase Progression Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 88,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 8,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "Provides a visual timeline of the build phases and their statuses",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to see the current stage of my build and how long each phase has taken so I can identify bottlenecks"
    },
    {
      "id": "agent_roster",
      "name": "Agent Roster Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 85,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 8,
        "impact": 8,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Lists all agents involved in the build with their current status and tasks",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to see which agents are working on my build and what they're currently doing so I can understand the progress"
    },
    {
      "id": "constitutional_status",
      "name": "Constitutional Status Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 87,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 8,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "Displays the status of key constitutional checks for the current build",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to know if my build is compliant with the OLYMPUS constitution so I can address any issues before deployment"
    },
    {
      "id": "understanding_panel",
      "name": "Understanding Your Build Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 82,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 7,
        "impact": 8,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Provides insights into what was built, why it was built that way, and known risks",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to understand the rationale behind the decisions made during my build so I can make more informed choices in the future"
    },
    {
      "id": "contextual_chat",
      "name": "Contextual Chat Panel",
      "category": "supporting",
      "priority": "should_have",
      "rice_score": 70,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 7,
        "impact": 7,
        "confidence": 7,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Allows users to ask questions about the current build in a collapsible side panel",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to be able to ask questions about my build and get answers from the system or other developers, so I can better understand what's happening"
    }
  ],
  "roadmap": {
    "phase_1_mvp": {
      "duration": "4-6 weeks",
      "features": [
        "build_list",
        "phase_progression",
        "agent_roster",
        "constitutional_status",
        "understanding_panel"
      ],
      "milestone": "Minimum Viable Product"
    },
    "phase_2_enhance": {
      "duration": "2-4 weeks",
      "features": [
        "contextual_chat"
      ],
      "milestone": "Enhanced Build Console"
    },
    "phase_3_scale": {
      "duration": "ongoing",
      "features": [],
      "milestone": "Scaling and Optimization"
    }
  },
  "technical_requirements": {
    "stack": {
      "frontend": "Next.js 14 + React 18 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS",
      "backend": "Next.js API Routes",
      "database": "Supabase"
    },
    "integrations": [
      "Supabase (for API endpoints)",
      "Lucide React (for icons)"
    ],
    "performance": {
      "initial_load": "<2s",
      "interaction_response": "<500ms",
      "lighthouse_target": ">90"
    },
    "security": [
      "HTTPS",
      "JWT-based authentication",
      "Input sanitization"
    ]
  },
  "success_criteria": {
    "launch_requirements": [
      "All critical features functional",
      "No TypeScript errors",
      "Responsive layout on desktop",
      "Core user flows completable end-to-end"
    ],
    "validation_metrics": [
      "Users can navigate the build console and find key information in <2 minutes",
      "Zero critical bugs in core user flows",
      "Positive user feedback on visibility and understanding of builds"
    ]
  },
  "featureChecklist": {
    "critical": [
      {
        "id": "build_list",
        "name": "Build List Panel",
        "description": "Shows a list of active and completed builds with status indicators",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a table of builds with columns for: build ID, status (queued/running/completed/failed), start time, end time, and duration",
          "Status is indicated with a colored icon (green for completed, yellow for running, red for failed)",
          "Clicking on a build row navigates to the individual build detail page",
          "Builds are sorted by start time, with the most recent at the top",
          "No hardcoded data - fetches from /api/builds endpoint"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 1,
        "rice_score": 90
      },
      {
        "id": "phase_progression",
        "name": "Phase Progression Panel",
        "description": "Provides a visual timeline of the build phases and their statuses",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a horizontal timeline with the following phases: discovery, design, architecture, frontend, backend, integration, testing, deployment",
          "Each phase shows its status (pending, active, completed, failed) with a colored indicator",
          "Phases are shown in order, with the current phase highlighted",
          "Hovering over a phase displays the start and end times, as well as a brief explanation of what that phase entails",
          "Data is fetched from the /api/builds/[buildId] endpoint"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 2,
        "rice_score": 88
      },
      {
        "id": "agent_roster",
        "name": "Agent Roster Panel",
        "description": "Lists all agents involved in the build with their current status and tasks",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a list of all 35 agents, organized by build phase",
          "Each agent card shows the agent's name, role, current status (idle, working, completed, failed), and their current task (if working)",
          "Agents with a 'working' status have a progress indicator to show how much of their task is complete",
          "Clicking on an agent card opens a modal with more detailed information about the agent and their contribution to the build",
          "Data is fetched from the /api/ai/agents endpoint"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 3,
        "rice_score": 85
      },
      {
        "id": "constitutional_status",
        "name": "Constitutional Status Panel",
        "description": "Displays the status of key constitutional checks for the current build",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Shows a maximum of 7 constitutional checks, each with a traffic light indicator (green, yellow, red)",
          "Each check displays the article name, status (compliant, warning, violation), and a brief one-sentence explanation",
          "The checks displayed are: No Shipping Without Understanding, Constitutional Tests Pass, Intent Satisfaction, Hostile Resistance, Stability Envelope, Architecture Integrity, Explanation Provided",
          "Data is fetched from the /api/builds/[buildId] endpoint"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 4,
        "rice_score": 87
      },
      {
        "id": "understanding_panel",
        "name": "Understanding Your Build Panel",
        "description": "Provides insights into what was built, why it was built that way, and known risks",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays three sections: 'What was built', 'Why it was built this way', and 'Known risks'",
          "The 'What was built' section lists the key components and files that were generated for the build",
          "The 'Why it was built this way' section explains the rationale behind the major decisions made during the build process",
          "The 'Known risks' section outlines any identified risks and their mitigation status",
          "Data is fetched from the /api/builds/[buildId] endpoint"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 5,
        "rice_score": 82
      }
    ],
    "important": [
      {
        "id": "contextual_chat",
        "name": "Contextual Chat Panel",
        "description": "Allows users to ask questions about the current build in a collapsible side panel",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "The chat panel is a collapsible side panel that appears when a build is selected",
          "Users can enter questions about the current build and receive responses from the system or other developers",
          "Responses are displayed in a chat-like interface with timestamps",
          "The chat panel is hidden by default and can be toggled open/closed using a button in the sidebar",
          "Chat messages are persisted to the /api/builds/[buildId]/chat endpoint"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 6,
        "rice_score": 70
      }
    ],
    "niceToHave": []
  },
  "risks": [
    {
      "risk": "Integrating with Supabase API for build and agent data",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Thoroughly test API integration during development, ensure robust error handling and fallbacks"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Maintaining performance and responsiveness with large amounts of build and agent data",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Implement pagination, infinite scrolling, and optimizations for efficient data fetching and rendering"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Accurately mapping constitutional checks to the build status",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Work closely with ORACLE and EMPATHY to define the constitutional checks and their mapping to build metrics"
    }
  ]
}

decisions.choice: {"pattern":"monolith","reasoning":"The OLYMPUS Builder Dashboard is a focused MVP with a limited num
decisions.reasoning: The OLYMPUS Builder Dashboard is a focused MVP with a limited number of features and entities. A monolith simplifies deployment and management and is suitable for the current scope of a single interface and user interaction.
